body.p: A single choice in a template.XULElem("menupopup") element. It acts much like a template.XULElem("button") but it is rendered on a template.XULElem("menu").
More information is available in the XUL tutorial.

body.div: Note: if the template.XULAttr("checked") attribute is set to true, and you persist its value via the template.XULAttr("persist") attribute, Mozilla will fail to persist its value when the template.XULElem("menuitem") is unchecked because of template.Bug(15232). A workaround is to set the template.XULAttr("autocheck") attribute to false, then programmatically set the template.XULAttr("checked") attribute when the user selects the item, and set it to false instead of removing the attribute (i.e. do menuitem.setAttribute("checked", "false") instead of menuitem.removeAttribute("checked")) when the user unchecks the template.XULElem("menuitem"), as a value of false will both correctly hide the checkmark and persist its hidden state.
Note: The menuitem must have a class of template.PrefAnch("s-", "menuitem-iconic") for the image to appear.
